title: Ticket #2192: condor_q exits with wrong return value
description:
Sam Gerstein wrote an email about condor_q https://lists.cs.wisc.edu/archive/condor-users/2011-May/msg00184.shtml

He found that "condor_q" and "condor_q -name my_schedd_hostname" produce the same output, but the second one returns exit code 1. Sam has condor 7.4.4 with quill on ubuntu.

We have condor 7.4.4 with quill on CentOS 5.6 and behaviour is the same.
remarks:
2011-May-26 16:24:42 by tannenba:
Code reviewed by tannenba, all good, patch pushed into V7_6_1-branch. Resolving ticket. Mucho thanks to author for the bug fix contribution.
attachments:
• 0001-Fix-return-value-of-condor_q-command.patch 1214 bytes added by slebodnik on 2011-May-26 15:36:26 UTC.
    In function "main" (queue.cpp) variable "retval" is initialized with zero int retval = 0;

    If condor_q was called with arguments "-name schedd_name", than function call from line 709 was successfully executed and print right results, but return value of this function was not saved.

    So variable "retval" stayed zero and thus condor_q exited with return code 1. exit(retval?EXIT_SUCCESS:EXIT_FAILURE); //line 846
check_ins: 2011-May-26 16:17   Check-in [21998]: Fixed problem with an incorrect exit code from condor_q when invoked with -name and using quill. #2192 ===VersionHistory=== Fixed problem with an incorrect exit code from condor_q when invoked with -name argument and using quill. Committer: Todd Tannenbaum (By Lukas Slebodnik )
creator: slebodnik
